channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The DOJ sued the federal district bench in Maryland. A judge just dismissed the case

item.title: How plants and fungi trade resources without a brain
item.description: Fungi and plants have something to teach humans about global trade and cooperation

item.title: What's the mortgage interest rate forecast for fall 2025?
item.description: Homebuyers and owners looking to refinance are hoping for a mortgage rate drop this fall. Here's what to expect.

item.title: France returns slain king's skull to Madagascar
item.description: King Toera was killed by French troops 128 years ago and his head kept in a Paris museum's archive.

item.title: Israeli hostage families and demonstrators hold day of protests
item.description: Families of hostages being held by Hamas are protesting across Israel in a day of marches, rallies and demonstrations.

item.title: Trump orders removal of Federal Reserve governor
item.description: Cook says the US president "has no authority to do so" in defiance of Trump's escalatory move against the central bank.

item.title: French PM fights for survival as rivals refuse to support confidence vote
item.description: Opposition parties say they will not back Prime Minister François Bayrou after a he called the vote over deep budget cuts.

item.title: Quit‑smoking ads are ending. A former smoker fears what comes next.
item.description: For 13 years, the CDC's "Tips" ads shared real stories and free quitline support. With funding ending, experts worry fewer people may quit.

item.title: U.S. markets hold steady in early trading Trump says he fired Lisa Cook
item.description: U.S. markets are holding steady Tuesday morning after President Trump attempts to fire Fed official Lisa Cook.
